Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that Indian police are beating up Muslims in Kashmir, without providing sufficient evidence or context.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough supporting evidence to prove that the video shows Indian police beating up Muslims. The video is actually a two-year-old footage of a protest by Gujjars in Jammu.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video depicts Indian police beating up Muslims in Kashmir, without verifying the authenticity or providing additional information.
Exist alternative explanation: The video actually shows a protest by members of the Gujjar community outside the residence of forest minister Chaudhary Lal Singh, over the alleged eviction of some members of the Gujjar community. It does not show Indian police beating up Muslims in Kashmir.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video is not related to Indian police beating up Muslims in Kashmir but rather a protest by the Gujjar community in Jammu.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the content of the video and misrepresents the situation by stating that it shows Indian police beating up Muslims in Kashmir.
